title: Web App for 13C breath test data

Details default, Search box top right corner contains text t50 filters table show values gastric emptying half-time , computed different methods. want restrict table show t50 computed Maes/Ghoos method, use drop-filter box column method. sort values one column, click /arrows. download print selected parameter table, use buttons top-right corner. display parameters clear text Search box.

title: Web App for 13C breath test data
text: curve 3 primary fit parameter exponential beta function marked method exp_beta. m: Effectively metabolized fraction 13C percentage, computed area PDF curve 0 infinity. parameter depends body weight height, may badly defined given. Since assumptions metabolics well defined, rarely interpreted. half-emptying time depend m, beta k. k: Time constant beta-exponential units 1/min; 1/k sometimes quoted emptying time tempt. k tempt rarely interpreted directly, derived quantities t50 tlag easier interpret. beta: dimensionless quantity, typically range 1 3. Primarily, (beta-1) degree polynomial minute = 0. beta = 2, function starts linear slope, beta = 3 like quadratic parabola slope = 0. higher values beta, results lag-like behavior, pronounced peak position shifts higher values. beta exponential fit function m=50, k = 0.03, different values beta. deviance: Deviance quantifies goodness fit, .e. deviation measured data points fit; smaller values indicate better fit. sorting deviance outlier curves can identified.

title: Web App for 13C breath test data
text: important derived parameter half-emptying time t50. can computed primary fit parameters different methods; see documentation references. maes_ghoos classical method Maes/Ghoos (often called Ghoos-method); compared half-emptying time MRI scintigraphy, values t50 much high. maes_ghoos_scint Maes/Ghoos half-emptying time, linear correction emptying times closer MRI scintigraphy. purely ad-hoc correction might work special meal, demonstrates one heroic attempts obtain realistic estimates method badly reflect real gastric processing. bluck_coward version proposed Bluck Coward correct estimated half emptying times. theory sound pharmacological foundation, clear evidence gives better validated estimates gastric emptying. second parameter often used describe lag gastric emptying tlag, method variants t50. * maes_ghoos tlag given position peak PDR time series. real lag show time shift without deformation curve, t_lag reasonable surrogate . * bluck_coward estimate useful, can negative.

title: Web App for 13C breath test data
text: Wagner-Nelson method semi-parametric apparently require functional fit, used PDR time series fitted single-fit method. approach valid rising slope PDR curve, uses fixed value quantify clearance reflect large degree variance subjects. Sanaka, Yamamoto, Tsutsumi, Abe, Kuyama (2005) Wagner-Nelson method analyzing atypical double-peaked excretion curve [13c]-octanoate gastric emptying breath test humans. Clinical experimental pharmacology physiology 32, 590-594 legacy package d13cbreath implemented method replace fixed estimate trailing slope fit, recommend method longer. Wagner-Nelson method originally introduced complex meals double-peaked excretion curves. handled successfully exponential-beta model, giving single value half-emptying time lags anyway questionable case. mixture model appropriate multi-peaked data; case can provide example PDR time series, please contact author package. Wagner-Nelson method also used individual curve fits using nonlinear fit functions nls often fail, omitting failed fits studies introduces bias. recommended method clinical studies uses hierarchical model implemented nlme Bayesian methods; latter also works single records.

title: Shiny Web App to Fit 13c Time Series from Breath Tests
text: Windows users must install Docker Desktop Docker store. installation details, see . Linux users know install Docker anyway. Docker least 2 GB memory. want build Docker image, need least 4 GB 2 cores; confusing error messages emitted memory low.

title: Shiny Web App to Fit 13c Time Series from Breath Tests
text: command line, enter following start container (ONE line) docker run --name breathtestshiny --restart unless-stopped -p 3838:3838 -d dmenne/breathtestshiny first startup needs time 1 GB downloaded. Subsequent startups require seconds. Connect app browser using localhost:3838.
